subject: Fashion
title: Photoshop and Unrealistic Standards
description: A short lesson to help you apply Photoshop and Unrealistic Standards.

hook.text: The average fashion photo is retouched for two hours. Pores vanish, waists shrink, skin glows unnaturally.

buildup.text: Since the 1990s, digital editing has made every published body a fiction‚Äîlegs lengthened, wrinkles erased.

discovery.text: Studies link retouched images to lower body satisfaction, even when viewers know the photos are fake.

twist.text: Some countries now require 'retouched image' labels. But labels don't undo the psychological damage.

climax.text: We compare real bodies to images no living person matches‚Äînot even the model in the original photo.

punchline.text: You're comparing yourself to someone who doesn't exist.

quiz.question: What do studies show about people who know fashion photos are digitally retouched?
options: They still experience lower body satisfaction despite knowing the images are altered
They become immune to the negative effects once they are aware of editing
They develop a stronger sense of self-confidence from recognizing manipulation
